page.title: 13FARMING-FAIRHOLME FARM
page.content: On Thursday 20th of June,two boys from Gotham School went to interview a farmer about his work.Fairholme Farm is an arable farm of 420 acres and has been owned by the Howick family since 1947.Mr Howick has worked there for the past 25 years,since leaving school at 15.They employ three full-time workers and two more at harvest time.They grow mainly barley and wheat,but also some potatoes and peas. The farm has just acquired two new large combine harvesters and they are trying to sell their two smaller ones. They also use five tractors and various attachments. In contrast,Gerald Taylor uses old farming methods to work his 12 acres of land.He uses 3 horses for ploughing and cultivating.He has built a gypsy caravan,the interior of which is beautifully hand-carved and decorated.
